intro: Tragia arabica var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved tragia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing on rocky soils or in disturbed areas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Tragia arabica var. parvifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
